Reviews.Title: “Nice room & location”
Reviews.Author: ltkelly39
Reviews.Content: We had a large OF efficiency at north end of boardwalk. This motel is one of the older ones but our room was very clean & everything worked well. I'm quite fussy when it come to cleanliness, so we were very happy and the price for an OF room was great comparitive to others. Overall, I'd recommend The Dunes for its location, price, amenities & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurie D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for a weekend getaway. We enjoyed our stay here. Nothing really fancy for the younger group but they do have a small lounge and rooms are clean and oceanfront. We would stay here again but if we bring our kids I would like to stay somewhere that offers more for the kids. It appeared that a lot of elderly people stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst shower of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Groucho53
Reviews.Content: While the location is great at the very end of the boardwalk.That is the BEST THING about the Dunes. This is the older blue building. After a day at the beach, a warm shower was what I wanted. What I got was a trickle of a shower that I tried for 20 minutes to get the sand and salt off my body: what a disappointment at the end of the day: also the towels were like sandpaper! I guess u need to stay in the Beige newer building!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: sunny45
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in an oceanfront efficiency. The room was very clean, housekeeping kept it clean each morning. The front desk staff was courteous and friendly upon check in and check out. Kitchen was equipped w/ dishes, utensils, pots/pan, dish drainer, coffee pot, toaster, dish towel & cloth & small liquid soap. Very convenient to prepare small meals. There is coffee in the lobby for guests that want it. They do give you small soaps in the bathroom. No other products like shampoos, lotions, etc are given. Beds were very comfortable. You could not hear a sound from any other rooms. The view from the balcony was awesome, overlooking the ocean, the dunes and to one side the boardwalk. The pool is also very nice. Large area of loungers, tables w/ umbrellas, etc. Plenty of parking so we never had an issue with where to park. Elevator worked fine. Luggage carts are available outside the elevator to help you get all your stuff moved in and out. The Boardwalk is right there at the end of the hotel. You can catch the tram car for $3.00 to take you to the other end of the boardwalk or rent bikes or surreys right at the beginning of the Boardwalk. Plenty of good places to eat within walking distance. You have use of the pool at their sister property, Dunes Manor, and it's a very nice indoor/outdoor pool. They have a large deck with rocking chairs to sit on and enjoy the view of the dunes and relax. I did a lot of research on where to stay in OC and am glad I picked this motel. I would recommend the Dunes Motel for the location, value, cleanliness and the awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Great, lower priced oceanfront motel!”
Reviews.Author: dilbertrocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recently vacationing in Ocean City, MD. We chose the Dunes Motel for two reasons. First, we LOVE ocean front rooms and secondly, we liked that this was near the boardwalk. The cost of the room per week was definitely another perk. It was much more affordable than other ocean front motels/hotels. The Dunes Motel is a bit older however it was very clean and well maintained. We stayed on the 4th floor and had a great view of the ocean. The kitchen was well stocked and the dishes were clean. We were worried about the refrigerator not working but after the first day it seemed fine and kept our groceries cold. The elevator was a bit slow but that is to be expected with older motels. The only complaint is that it was a bit noisy. The garbage man came every morning around 7am and woke us up which was a bummer for vacation. We would definitely choose this motel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most near Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: squeezll
Reviews.Content: Had a first floor oceanfront room. Actual view of ocean is blocked by the dunes on the first floor, but the upside is a large outdoor private patio space and direct beach access from the back of the room. Having stayed at a large number of hotels, condos and houses in OCMD over the years, I would rank this somewhere in the middle. I would have probably had a better feeling with new carpet and updated bedspread, but all in all the room was fairly priced for the holiday weekend. Bathroom was newly painted with new flooring and the unit was very clean overall. At this point in my life, I am looking for aesthetic comfort as well, but the hotel gave me all I needed for the weekend. Hair dryers were available, but we had to go back to the front office to pick it up. I probably won't look to stay here again, but would consider it if my usual favs are all sold out.

Reviews.Title: “awesome, awesome, awesome....”
Reviews.Author: shirley c
Reviews.Content: this was our first visit to ocean city so of course i looked up alot of hotel/motels online, i came the dunes motel read the reviews and was very pleased with the reviews, so we booked a room which was on the 5th floor smoking. the room was very very clean it did not what so ever smell of smoke in room. the view of the ocean was breathtaking. the room was to my likings 100% . we were on the beach or wandering around most of time or simply just enjoying the ocean view on the balcony. each day the maid came in they did an awesome job making it look like we just checked in, having a full kitchen saved us money from eating out alot. we all enjoyed our stay there and would definatily without a doubt stay there in our future trips there. the staff were very friendly. dunes manor motel is #1 in my book for best place to stay. thanks for a wonderful first time stay there! from a very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: GaryAndDenise
Reviews.Content: The property is clean and well-maintained. The staff is courteous and efficient. The location is great. For the price, it can't be beat. Even after checkout they let us keep our car in the parking lot until we were ready to leave and offered use of the pool and showers at their sister hotel next door. I plan to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: kathen302
Reviews.Content: We decided to go down (from DE) for 1 night. This is usually impossible because most beach areas have at least a 2 night min. Read the reviews and then checked availability and decided to take a chance. I'm very glad we did. We are a family of 5 that usually stays in Residence Inn type hotels because we need the extra bed. The Motel offered an oceanfront efficiency that had 2 double beds and a pull out. Perfect. Check in was fast and our room was ready. I booked a corner so I could have an unobstructed view from at least one side. The entry and bathroom has new tile floors and it looked like the whole place had been freshly painted. Everything was very clean. We had a problem at first w the toilet taking forever to fill, called down and they sent someone up right away. Come to find out, its just a slow toilet. The efficiency has a stove, full sized fridge, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, and dishes. You are at the end of the boardwalk and can buy tickets right there. Theres also bathrooms so you dont need to go back up to your room if you really need to go. Overall I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: rougeelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of August 6th. This was our first vacation in Ocean City and we chose the Dunes Motel after reading many reviews. This is a clean, quiet motel. We stayed in the pool side in your basic motel room. The furnishings were a little dated but it was a non-smoking room which had no smoky or musty ordors. I was very pleased at the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. The maid service was excellent. Every morning when we returned from breakfast our room had been cleaned, vacumned and the bathroom was stocked with plenty of fresh towels. We had one of the light bulbs go out and within 5 minutes of our call to the front desk a knock was on our door and the bulb was replaced. It is also a great location. Far enough away from the craziness of the boardwalk but close enough to take a very long walk or pick up the nearby tram. The beach was clean and not overly crowded. I hope on our next trip to stay in one of the oceanside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased !!!”
Reviews.Author: michellep1970
Reviews.Content: Clean and Quiet.Stayed with family for 2 nights in July. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Only wished coffee makers were in rooms not in main lobby and wished ice machines were on each floor instead of just on the first floor. We stayed in a poolside room but, never got to swim in the pool because it closed at 9PM. But, we got to swim in the ocean alot so, that made up for it.Motel was a small Walking distant to the TRAM station and Beach it was a little bit of a hike on foot to the Boardwalk. But, over all we will probably stay there again. Next time with an Ocean view! For the price this Motel is definitely worth it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dotnbri1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this motel 3 times, and have always been satisfied. It is a motel-not the Ritz, but it is clean, in a great location, and the staff is friendly. This time we stayed in a patio suite. It had one queen bed, a pull down bed, and a sofa bed, a stove, fridge, kitchen table, small bathroom, and large, fenced, private patio with chairs. We loved having our own patio that lead right to the beach access through the dunes. The boardwalk tram loads right outside, which is great, and since it is at the end of the boardwalk, you don't have the crowd noise. Good for families on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places we have ever stayed in OC.”
Reviews.Author: beachgal587
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days here the end of July. We had a beautiful view of the ocean on the 4th floor. We stayed in the efficiency and it was nice and clean, and believe me I checked. The only problem we had was our TV remote wouldn't work, I called the desk to let them know, and they were very nice, and the maintenance man came up immediately and fixed it, it quit working again, he came back and put in a new code, and it worked, he even gave us the code he used in case it happened again, it did, but we just reprogrammed it, and it was fine. I loved being at the end of the Boardwalk, right next to the Tram station. Close to one of our favorite places, Fractured Prune, we walked to get donuts, and then I would stop in the motel office for their free coffee, which was excellent by the way. Parking wasn't a problem either, which is a big thing with my husband. The motel pool was nice, clean. Loved that the motel had an elevator too, was really nice when you were lugging all your beach gear. We didn't have any trouble with anyone being loud or noisy, staff seemed nice and friendly. I think I don't have to look for anymore motels, this is the one for us!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: nds579
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more with all the great reviews but it was just okay. We stayed in a poolside room and it was very small and dark. There were only 2 pillows on both beds so that means the 4 of us only had one pillow and when we asked for four more they only gave us two. However, it is clean and a great location at the end of the boardwalk. You get to use the Dunes Manor hotel's ameneties which is cool but a little inconvenient having to walk over. I think I'd rather pay extra and stay at their hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Stoneham1
Reviews.Content: Room very small, but clean. We got here early and could not check in until 3:00 even though many rooms were ready. No space for a family of 4. Good location to boardwalk, though. Just okay. Would not recommend for a long stay. Restaurant food just okay. Overpriced, and not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Anne8771
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is the best location in Ocean City. I have stayed here before and being at the end of the boardwalk and within short walking distance to everything it can't be beat. The place is more run down then I remembered from a few years ago. We had no water pressure in the shower at all (could not get the sand off). I mentioned this when we were leaving and the front desk said I should have called to have the shower head replaced but not sure this would have worked anyway. It was not as clean and the refrig. had rust all over it and food was splashed everywhere. Housekeeping did not vacuum the sandy carpet one of the days. But all said I do like this place and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cdickey14
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights poolside and 1 night oceanfront. Rooms basically the same except the oceanfront room was much larger and had a kitchenette. Hotel seems well run and the staff is courteous and accommodating. Rooms were clean and had basic necessities. Location was excellent - away from the noise of the boardwalk but within a minutes's walk. I would definitely recommend the oceanfront rooms over the poolside ones. For the additional expense you get more space and can do easy meals in your room to save the difference in what you pay for oceanfront.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Erika N
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but great price and great location. Clean, clean,clean! Beds are not very comfortable, but for a few nights it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “So Pleased with My Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Supermomo2
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Ocean City and I had no idea it was the sand soccer championships. 6,000 Tweens running around. I was so happy when I realized that we were nowhere near all the crowds and kids and sand soccer fields as far as the eye could see at the south side of the beach. The Dunes is the first motel after the boardwalk ends. A fabulous location and great for the price. Near to all the local attractions, plus all the motel guests have access to the Dunes Manor Hotels indoor/outdoor pool, restaurant and beachside bar n grill. The room is quaint but the oceanfront efficiency fit a family of 5 perfectly. The furniture is dated but the room was clean and the full kitchen was entirely stocked with ice trays, cooking utensils, flatware, dishes, dishdrain, pots, pans and juice pitcher. Perfect for picky eaters like my kids. I was able to cook their favorites and save some money at the same time. Remember to pack your own coffee filters. If you stay more than one night they do clean the rooms make beds vacuum and give more towels. Bring your own as well. We went to and from the beach and pool several times and each time it was nice to have a clean towel to dry my little ones. Bring hand soap they only have that yucky hotel bar soap. It was great! We arrived early and received our parking pass and went exploring. The staff was friendly and accommodating. It was such a lovely stay, we will be back for years to come. Perfect for the price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect at end of boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: FBOOTH6
Reviews.Content: 2nd time we've stayed here...why spend more money at the Dunes Hotel when you can use it's amenities and stay here! We still use both pools (the one at the motel and the indoor/outdoor one at the hotel)... the one at the hotel has a barefoot bar available until 5PM. This motel has everything you need for a great stay at OC. Right at the end of the boardwalk on 27th so the bike rentals are right next door. The beach isn't as crowded as down further and it took us 6 minutes to get to the end of the board walk on bikes... the beach is clean and perfect. the staff are friendly and there is coffee at the motel every morning. Parking is free and there are 2 crab restaurants within walking distance! 7-11 across the way as well. Pool's are nice, warm and clean. The fitness room isn't very good though (only has a few machines) Housekeeping does a wonderful job everyday keeping our room tidy. Better value than others on this strip. Perfect for all, including families... our room had 3 beds(with the sofa pullout) and each room overlooks the ocean(in the building we stayed in) thx! HPeck

Reviews.Title: “right at beginning of boardwalk right on the sand!”
Reviews.Author: StrwbryShrtK
Reviews.Content: I've been going to OCMD since I was 5 yrs old. It's become my 2nd home :) Without a doubt The Dunes Motel is a great hotel. The Dunes Motel is situated at the beginning of the boardwalk, next to the tram station so you're only a tram ride away from everything on the boards. It's the quiet end of the boardwalk. We had both pool side and Oceanfront and really couldn't have been happier. Room was plenty big for our family of 4 (2 kids and 2 adults). The size in Oceanfront is really big and the kitchenette was great. The view from the balcony of Oceanfront is of course such a spectacular view of the dunes & Atlantic Ocean. The only thing I wish they had was wifi so if you need to use wifi you would have to go next door to The Dunes Manor Hotel for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front & The Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: flymetothemoon22
Reviews.Content: This is my go to motel in OC. Make sure you stay in an ocean front room. You are right at the end of the boardwalk - so you have access to take a stroll or shop plus your right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Rowdy Place”
Reviews.Author: hoopscoach-dmar
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive motel for a two-night stay. Because of the cheaper price, we chose a poolside room over an ocean front room. The only rooms available were a non-smoking room with a king-sized bed, and a smoking room with two double beds. We really do not like staying in smoking rooms because of the smell of stale smoke. My wife has asthma and I get nauseous when I smell smoke for too long. However, since our daughter was staying with us we needed a room with two beds, so we went with the smoking room. The room included two double beds, a refrigerator, and a microwave. The room was clean, but we were able to smell the stale smoke. The bathroom had a fan and the shower was very forceful. The towels were typical of what you get at a cheap motel. They were very thin and well worn. There was a shower curtain, but no liner. When you took a shower, you got water all over the floor. This was "senior week" at the beach, so we knew we were taking a chance by staying at an inexpensive motel. Any time you mix alcohol and recently graduated high school seniors, you are asking for trouble. Some of the motels do not care about the noise; they want to rent the rooms. Late at night, we heard kids running and yelling. We ignored the noise and went back to sleep. This happened about every hour or so until it finally stopped. We found out why the next day. I was speaking to one of the other guests. He asked me if I had heard the noise. I told I had, but we mostly slept through it. He said it sounded like a “gang war.” He told me that the cops finally came to try to quiet things down. There were a lot fewer guests the next day, so I assume the kids were evicted. He told me “Never again.” I can understand as he had traveled from Pittsburgh with his family and expected to have a nice stay in Ocean City. I suppose that it was not a bad room for the price. However, I would not recommend that families or couples stay there. It is definitely a place for young 18 and 19 year olds who want to party. A message to hotel owners: “If you insist on allowing smoking in the rooms, please clean the room when the smokers leave.” I guess you get what you pay for. We will not return to the Dunes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jyanick
Reviews.Content: We knew coming to the hotel that it would be typical of an older motel: older bedspreads, ect.....but really, does that matter? We booked an oceanfront efficiency, which I felt was spacious, the view was outstanding, and it was CLEAN! The beds were very comfortable and they had recently replaced the tile floor in the bathroom. The sofabed/dining table area of the room had a partition you could close, which was perfect for when we put our daughter to bed but still wanted to relax in the balcony! The location was perfect for us in that it is the first motel after the boardwalk ends, and the team stop is steps from your room. Traveling with a child we found the noise level to be minimal, we all slept well. Upon departure we were asked for feedback from the manager in duty and she shared with us that they are working to correct some of the small issues other guests have had (shower temp fluctuating). Somebody posted a pic of a "disgusting" bathtub floor, and really all it was is the discoloration of the non skid patches from everyone's sandy feet. I gave my daughter baths in there and she was just fine! Some helpful hints: any food will be about a 10 block walk so just take the tram! The shower temp did waver between hot and cold, be patient about it. Parking is plentiful we never had a problem finding a spot.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: delaware33
Reviews.Content: This is an older establishment in Ocean City MD, however it was extremely clean which is the most important to me. The furniture needs updating but again it was well kept. We had an ocean front room and the view was incredible. Other hotels in this area were much more expensive so it was a great value. The front office staff were very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, nice people, affordable”
Reviews.Author: aismith
Reviews.Content: This motel is all you need if you are looking for friendly staff, a very clean room and an affordable price. The rooms are basic, but very nice. Ours had two double beds (comfortable!), fridge & microwave, nice TV, and small table w/ two chairs. Nice picture window overlooking the pool to let plenty of sunshine in. Bathroom was also very clean and well stocked with towels and such. Only soap provided, so be sure to have your own shampoo. I could not get over how much this motel mirrored The Empress motel on 20th street, where we stayed two years ago. In fact I would swear the two buildings were built of the exact same set of plans. Beyond the physical building being identical though, it was uncanny how they both take such great care in keeping their places clean, and in hiring such pleasant staff. If you are looking for the fancier features and ambiance, you may want to try the Dunes Manor hotel next door. Built by the same lady that owned the Dunes, but a large oceanfront high rise unit. If it is an ultra clean, comfortable motel room that lets you actually afford to take the kids to the beach, you absolutely will not go wrong with The Dunes!

Reviews.Title: “best kept motel”
Reviews.Author: Denise R
Reviews.Content: This motel is always clean and neat. The management is also wonderful. I have never had a bad visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this will be hard to top”
Reviews.Author: randgust
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there are better motel properties in Ocean City. But an Ocean View efficiency over easter week for $57 off-season right at the end of the boardwalk? I'll admit I was skeptical, and put my faith in the TripAdvisor ratings a little more than usual. I was even more skeptical when I drove in, looking at the empty parking lot and the streetside motel building. But this is a three-building development; the big beachside hotel, a beachside motel, and a streetside motel. We stayed in the beachside motel, up on the 4th floor to see over the dunes (you don't want on the first floor, all you can see is the dunes). To be fair, you're going to have completely different experiences based on which one of these buildings you are in. But my oh my. Efficiency apartment, two double beds and a pullout, a balcony, a very functional kitchen... everything worked, everything clean, and the service was excellent. The view from the balcony was unforgettable. The room had just been retouched over the season prior to our arrival, I think we were the first in it of the year. We had to have maintenance come and unclog a drain, did well. Front desk service was very good. We had to make a call on noisy neighbors, that was handled well too. We went over to the hotel for dinner, obvously that's a much newer operation and comparatively plush, but still only $10 more. I'd rather be where we were right on the end of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value During the Off-Season”
Reviews.Author: Julian K
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Dunes and paid only about $60 per night. For that value we received a spacious and luxurious suite with a full kitchen, two beds, an ocean front balcony and a leather sofa. You simply cannot beat that! When we were calling around, looking for vacancies, some of the other hotels quoted us double what we paid to stay at the dunes. The downside: We have seen a few unsavory folks hanging out in the parking lot. The hotel restaurant has a fairly limited menu. The Dunes is very close to Jolly Rogers' park, Philips, and Embers. Although the boardwalk tram is closed right now, the stop is extremely close. There are plenty of Put golf places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great !”
Reviews.Author: Chanee C
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year. The rooms are clean. The help is friendly. The location is great. Right at the end of the boardwalk. Close to everything. (7-11 is one block over) You can ride the tram from the end of the boardwalk to the inlet. I reccomend this place to couples and families. My kids had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: kalim53
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price and reviews solely!! We were going to the beach for one night and were not looking to spend a lot of money. The hotel was the cheapest for the night ! We were shocked as the room was oceanfront and even had a mini kitchenette in it! The reviews were mixed so we were kinda iffy but figured what the hech and booked it anyway! Upon arrival the staff was friendly. The hotel was clean and orderly. The room had a huge window overlooking the ocean. the kitchen area was small but would take care of your needs. The fridge/freezer was full size!! The bathroom was spottless and Im picky about hotel bathrooms! The sheets were clean! No sign of bedbugs anywheres. The balcony was larger than expected!! the hotel was a pleasant surprise.. Would recommened!

Reviews.Title: “Meh minus”
Reviews.Author: CoolYule
Reviews.Content: Maybe my problem is that I was comparing it to a motel I stayed at right before (which received lower reviews but was FAR superior), but was quite disappointed with The Dunes motel. Visit started off badly from the start - filthy bathtub with a "teenage" roach lounging in it (see portrait). First things first - immediate trip to drugstore to purchase flip-flops to shower in. Had Lysol with me and used it EVERYWHERE. Rooms are very dated but good size and well-appointed. Great balcony with FABULOUS view (aside from some off-season boardwalk construction, which is not the motel's fault). Surf so close, you feel like you can touch it. Great kitchennette with all one may need. Sheets and towels were clean. Not happy with maid service. Yes, they vacuumed. But returned to hair all over sink, tub and toilet. Sure, it's MY hair. I'm shedding. But I expect the maid to clean it before she takes the generous tip I left her. Kinda the point of a maid. To clean your bathroom. It beats being at work. But will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach at the end of the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Dunes every summer for many years. There's a reason we keep returning - location, location, location. It's at the end of the boardwalk at 27th Street and it sits right on the beach. We always stay in the OCEANFRONT BUILDING (not the motel itself) and always stay in the first floor patio apartment. Note: There is a sand dune in front of the building and the first floor units can not view the beach/ocean. However, we find that the convenience of the first floor is wonderful. Every first floor unit has it's own grassy area/patio and they're individually fenced. When you leave the beach, you bring your chairs right to your patio, and don't have to drag them inside your unit to the balcony. The furnishings are typical beachy furnishings. Nothing modern. The efficiency kitchen area is nothing to brag about but everything is very clean. Dishes, flatware and some glasses are supplied but I never use anything I can't run thru the dishwasher first. And I always bring my own frying pan because people are so unkind to stainless steel cookware. The Dunes offers daily maid service and they do a good job and I've never had any issues with things stolen (but I do hide my valuables). We went in mid-July when the weather is hot and the ocean temps are bearable. I do NOT recommend this property in the month of June because it's taken over by graduated high school seniors and they are very obnoxious - and they love The Dunes because it's cheap. I always have at least one issue with our key card. This last trip I had three within 12 hours. Very frustrating but what can you do, not like it's really anyone's fault. Sometimes a key would be better. I highly recommend The Dunes. I wish it was just a little more on the boardwalk, like at 16th St. but the higher you go up that boardwalk, the pricier things are and the more crowded the beach is.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time Experience”
Reviews.Author: TB610
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first trip to Ocean City Maryland. The Dunes' Motel did not disappoint. The room was clean and smelling fresh as soon as we walked in. There were no issues at check-in. The process was courteous, quick and professional. Our rooms were cleaned daily and all the staff greeted you with a friendly smile and hello. The only problem is it was four of us and we had a standard room...two double beds. It worked out but next time we will book a oceanfront suite at either the motel or the hotel. We couldn't get the oceanfront becase the motel was sold out of them. The staff however told us on numerous occassions we had full access to the hotel and all of their amenities. This was AWESOME vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: alphamomof2
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel based on other reviews and we certainly weren't disappointed! We arrived before our room was ready, but were given a parking pass right away. When we did get to our room (we had the oceanfront efficiency) the first thing we noticed was the clean, clean smell of the room. There was ample space for us and our two kids (11 years and 9 months). The room was very clean as was the bathroom. The beds were comfortable with clean, crisp sheets. The location was fantastic...being at the very end of the boardwalk and across the street from Jolly Roger, it was very convenient to just about everything, yet much quieter and less crowded than the hotels further up the boardwalk. The pool was small yet clean and never got too crowded. The employees were exceptionally nice at the front desk. We're already planning on coming down again next summer...and we will be staying at the Dunes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Vacation0807
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Dunes Motel. I did plenty of research looking for a hotel/motel. I read many reviews and it seemed like this one had the most positive responses so that is why I chose it and very happy I did. The room was clean and didn't seem small to us (3 adults and 2 children). The shower had great water pressure which you usually don't find in a hotel/motel. We stayed in room 418 and never closed the blinds....didn't want to miss the great view! It was wonderful to have the beach and the tram right outside our door with 2 small children. The only thing that I didn't like was the parking. It was so cramped with limited spaces. But that wouldn't stop me from staying there again. I hope to go back next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great efficiency overlooking the ocean or dunes”
Reviews.Author: Rob L
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay overlooking the ocean or the dunes. The higher up the more ocean you see. The 1st floor has beach front access however can only see the dunes. The 2-5 floors overlook the ocean however must walk around building to get to the beach. Our room was an efficiency equipped with 2 beds a sleeper sofa, table, stove, fridge, dishes etc. The room was cramped when using the sleeper sofa. Other than that looked just like a hotel room but with a small kitchen. Theroom had maid service everyday. The best thing about the room was the oceanfront balcony. Has an outdoor pool just a short walk away. However even though you stay at Motel you can use the Hotel indoor/outdoor pool as well, including showers. It was a great stay and great service. Mention the "Rodney Saves" deal and they give you $50 off at hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Resoanable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Dodgerdoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Motel from 8/14 - 8/17. If you insist on 4 star accommodations this is not the place for you. if you are looking for a reasonable place within steps of the beach it's just fine. We stayed in a poolside room for $134/night in high season. We considered this rate quite reasonable. The rooms have two double beds (wish they were queens!!), a refrigerator and small microwave. The room was clean and the bathroom likewise. You can tell they're trying to keep the place up-- the bathtub had been resurfaced and the tiles were shining white. There were small signs of wear and tear-- draperies with a minor tear, furniture edges slightly worn and a few chips out of that resurfaced tub. We arrived on a terribly rainy day and our bathroom window leaked quite a bit and we had to sop up with a towel. When we returned home at 10 PM the first night and I went to the desk to asked for additional towels and two additional pillows , the clerk was able to get the towels and one pillow but the additional pillow was not to be had because " the housekeeper just left". We don't know if our window was ever fixed as it stopped raining. They did allow a late check out (1PM) on our day of departure which was very helpful. No internet here but you can walk over to their sister hotel and get it there. All in all a great value and the day-time staff seemed to be long-time employees who were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Was a decent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ASHMD
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. We were right at the end of the boardwalk and there was a public restroom available on the beach. The check in was pretty smooth and our room was ready about 45 minutes early. We lucked out and got our room cleaned pretty quickly the next day because by chance we were leaving for the beach when the maid was coming by. We did hear lots of complaints from others that their rooms were not cleaned until almost 4pm. But were lucky. The place is not fancy. But, the room did the trick for us and the pool (although freezing) was a decent size and clean. We came for a quick weekend getaway and would stay here again. However, my biggest complaint is with parking. They clearly do not check their lot for folks that should not be parked there. On several occasions we came back to the hotel and couldn't find a spot. We'd then have to drive around the area to find a place to put our car. This was a huge inconvenience. The staff seemed to know of the issue and just failed to do anything about it. Other than that, decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “best we could find and it was ALL good”
Reviews.Author: JulGirlie
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd year in a row we stayed in the exact same rooms. We get 3 rooms for our 3 families. they have interlocking rooms in some as well. The boardwalk tram is right outside the hotel garage which is perfect to keep you out of the hustle and bustle until you want it! Maids are fantastic. They have afternoon tea and biscuits with marmalade. Every room facing the ocean and has a balcony. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Now Know Where I'll Go Every Summer!”
Reviews.Author: andrew69_10
Reviews.Content: The Dunes is the best bang for your buck that you could find. The location is ideal...right at the beach, right at the beginning/end of the boardwalk, within walking distance of numerous restaurants, bars, and things to do- and all without quite the congestion you get down the south end. You could stay here for a week and conceivably never get in your car the whole time. The rooms are spotless and the beds perfectly comfortable. Pool is very nice and was never crowded. One of the best things is how you are actually also a guest at the more lavish Dunes Manor, just two doors down. You'll love it there, too. I write this review because of how pleased I was and because the owners deserve the good publicity. But, I hope it doesn't get too popular!

Reviews.Title: “WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: sarah7694
Reviews.Content: CLEAN CLEAN and CLEAN.....great water pressure, plenty of towels, nice size fridge, great staff, and GREAT location. My stay was the first week 7/31 to 8/4 and I chose this motel according to location, price and past reviews....and I am so happy that I trusted what pple were saying. I was MORE than pleased with everything, a little suprised actually. I stayed in a 2 double bedded room over looking the pool with fridge and microwave....PERFECT...thanks so much DUNES! Hope you all enjoy ur stay like we did.....from NW PA...:)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: cd103341
Reviews.Content: Traveled June 2010. And had a non-smoking poolside room. Everything was clean and tidy, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time~”
Reviews.Author: SanjKel2011
Reviews.Content: Loved the Dunes Motel! My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. The people at the front desk were very accommodating and friendly. When we first got to our room, we realized it was an adjoining room and asked the front desk if we could change rooms. The women at the desk said they would work on it and let us know if they could make the change because the motel was close to capacity. Well, after about an hour the front desk called us and told us they were able to change our room. We were satisfied. The place is clean and well maintained. We booked a pool view room that had a refrigerator (good size) and microwave (fairly small). The AC definitely worked, our room was an ice box!! The location is awesome. It is the 1st motel on the boardwalk so the area is fairly quiet compared to downtown. You can take the trolley (for a small fee) from the motel, straight to downtown. The beach is steps away which was great too. The pool is a decent size, it was never overly packed. There is a shower for people to use before/after pool usage. They also have a kiddy pool. Each morning the pool was cleaned by the grounds crew and it didn't smell like chlorine. We had breakfast at the Victorian (the sister hotel, Dunes Manor Hotel). The food was fresh and fairly priced compared to local restaurants The only thing that would have been nice is if they had more ice machines, there was 1 ice machines and that was located inn the front desk in the lobby. Overall, I would recommend this motel to anyone looking for a simple, clean place to stay. We will definitely return! Recommendations: Food: Brassballs Saloon: (breakfast) you could sit outdoors upstairs in the shade with a beautiful view. Charlie's Restaurant: a bit of a drive north but well worth it. The food was fresh and delicious! It is more of a locals restaurant so it wasn't packed. It was located on the bay. We had outdoor seating so we were able to watch the sunset. Higgins: Next door to Dunes, dinner was good, we all enjoyed the seafood. JR's Ribs: Good Food, great service and decent price. Activities: Jolly Roger Park: 5 parks at 1 location! Jolly Roger Park was right across the street from the Dunes Motel, so we walked. We were told that the price drops from $36.99+ to $20.99 at 2:45pm so we went at 2:45pm (we were there for only 2 hours so it was worth it for us). Walk the Boardwalk: Plenty of sights to see and it's free

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit to the Dunes Motel”
Reviews.Author: Familyvacationer101
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Dunes Motel twice before, I was just as happy the third stay as prior stays. To our surprise, our room was upgraded to oceanfront first floor, patio suite instead of the motel poolside room we thought we would be staying in. The room was perfect for our group of three. It had a separate bedroom for two and than the kitchen and another bed. The patio was perfect for laying out our wet swimsuits and towels. You can't get much closer to the beach than walking right out of our room onto the sand. Great location, great price, very clean, and great times had. Can't get much better than that! Overall, the Dunes Motel is a great place to stay and I would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel...Great Location...!”
Reviews.Author: LisaRena
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel...very, very clean, super comfy beds, crisp sheets, fantastic water pressure in shower on the 5th floor! Great Location...boardwalk starts next to hotel with tram service down to the busy section of boardwalk...Only problem was parking...beach goers who weren't staying in hotel would park on the lot and management did not tow them. Visited their sister hotel Dunes Manor and sat on the outdoor bar...Love the Dunes!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Great Family Motel”
Reviews.Author: loriann0702
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at the Dunes..and we will definetely be back! We stayed in an Oceanfront Efficiency. Loved sitting on the balcony and watching the ocean. The beach was just steps away. This motel is the last one on the boardwalk, away from all of the noise and crowds. We took the bus, tram or just drove to the other end of the boardwalk. Housekeeping was great, cleaned the room every morning. Our room was spotless from the time we arrived to the day we left. Plus, you can go to the Dunes Manor for tea every afternoon. Our daughter spent a few hours in the pool, but honestly, we were at the beach for hours every day. Already lanning another visit to the Dunes! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A few small issues, but we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Karen_C_1973
Reviews.Content: When we got there, our room was ready and we had a speedy check-in! A beautiful view awaited us on the 4th floor along with comfy beds and clean dishes. My only negative issue is about the amount of drawer space you have. It's not much, but as a family of 4 we made it all work. We're there for the beach, not to stay in the room all the time. The only other issue we had was that our magnetic key card stopped working. We asked our floor maid to try the door and she did without success either. After waiting 25 mins or so for a maintenance person to come and help, I went to the front desk asking if we had been forgotten about. Turns out that the maid didn't communicate the fact that we were waiting to get into the room. Once we spoke with the front desk, it was less than 5 minutes before someone was at our door getting us into the room. It turned out that the batteries that provide power to the computer chip had died and needed to be replaced. In the end that minor inconvenience was just that minor! The last thank that I'm happy about is that the staff let us keep our car in their lot the day we checked out. We didn't have to find on street parking, which in OC can be difficult. It was a great stay and an affordable place and we'll no doubt stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and hope to be back!”
Reviews.Author: dinie202
Reviews.Content: It is a great little motel very clean the only problem that I had was my room was right next door to the washer and dryer for the hotel. So I would make sure when making a reservations not to stay in room 104 had complained to the desk he wished he could have helped by moving us but only have 3 rooms that have king size bed and efficiency and they were all booked.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle88
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We're a family of four, children were 3 and 8 at the time of arrival. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and comfortable and had a fantastic view. We were steps to the boardwalk but far enough away from the noise and traffic of it. The beach was right out the front door. We'll definately visit again someday.

Reviews.Title: “It's like going home”
Reviews.Author: frederick26
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for years and always come back, its like going home!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, simple stay at the dunes motel.”
Reviews.Author: RachelLynnH
Reviews.Content: For a beach motel, i couldnt have asked for much more. it was a small but clean room. the bed was comfortable and tv was new! it isnt the most classy motel/hotel. but for being on the beach it was comfortable! it sits right at the end of the boardwalk which was great for us but lots of walking to the busy parts! noise was never an issue either. the only thing that got annoying was the shower would change tempture. but thats really all i have to complain about! it was a great stay, we will probably try to book it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine beach hotel in good, beach front location”
Reviews.Author: Missty
Reviews.Content: Spent a long early summer weekend with my 11yo daughter at this perfectly fine beach motel with great location at end of the boardwalk and in mid-town. Impressed with cleanliness and comfortable beds! No problem with parking, maid service, or water pressure in our 4th floor room. Enjoyed close access to Hotel as well as Hotel's restaurant, lobby wifi, and pool (and poolside bar). Motel pool was fine for a quick evening dip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda624
Reviews.Content: We rented the ocean front suite and loved it!!!! The patio and private entrance to the beach was amazing. You are at the end of the boardwalk which is quiet....bus station, tram, food, shopping andamusement park all with a minutes walking distance. We have such great memories and are already planning next years vacation at the Dunes Motel!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: ocgurl45
Reviews.Content: This hotel was acceptable but missing some of the basics. You are allowed to use the amenities at the Dunes Manor, but this hotel is two hotels over and not very convenient. The shower had only a trickle of water pressure. Parking is limited and we were lucky that there was one space left. There was no blow dryer available that usually all hotels have. The staff was friendly, but you won't see them unless you go to the office. We were in a nonsmoking room but our neighbors smoked out on the balcony the entire time anyway. Although the whole floor was supposed to be nonsmoking. We did enjoy our view of the ocean and the proximity of the tram station. A shower is a basic need though and the$ 250 a night price won't be justified until they upgrade the plumbing.We didn't use the pool but did walk past and noted how small it is. This place is very clean and the furniture and beds were fine. They should upgrade the tv's also. Again, it wasn't a bad stay, but I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: drew1219
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the past and it didn't disapoint us. Great view and clean rooms. We had a wonderful time with our 12 year old. The few negatives were... My number one complaint was the maid service. We would leave to go to the ocean at 9am and put our Maid tag on the door but when we returned our room was never cleaned before 2:30pm. The Maid tag does you no good. Room was clean when we got there but had some garbage behind the fridge (yes you could see behind it). The fridge took awhile to cool our drinks and food.Also NO Wireless internet. I recommend they get this. If you want internet you have to go to the Hotel next door. Also if you want ice you have to go to the lobby. Only ice machine is in the lobby. Kinda expensive but considering the time of year we went and compared to other hotels it was nice. All in all had a good experience but they really need to either hire more maids or light a fire under the ones they have.

Reviews.Title: “very nice peaceful”
Reviews.Author: pappyq
Reviews.Content: great place very clean and quiet will go back soon as possible great value for early vacation had a ocean front efficency and was very pleased

Reviews.Title: “Dunes Motel is a clean, affordable, nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SLM322
Reviews.Content: 3 adults, 3 kids - we stayed in a patio suite (one bedroom w/2 dbls, and living area had pull out couch which wasn't too bad. The room had a kitchenette, full size fridge, little oven, micro, etc. along with dishes/flatware, dishsoap, rags, and some cooking items. The patio was great because it added extra space for the kids to play and super easy access to the beach. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. Our coffee pot didn't work. We called the front desk and had a new one (delivered by a very nice person) within 5 mins. Front desk was pleasant and helpful, all the staff we saw were friendly. Pool area was nice also...the kids pool was "out of order" but the 3' end of the adult pool worked out well for us. Plenty of seating and the outside shower and water fountain at the pool area was great! Location of the hotel is good too. At the end of the boardwalk, public restrooms and tram access right there. 7-eleven in walking distance also. All in all we would def. stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this motel”
Reviews.Author: Anne8771
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dunes motel in a oceanfront room. I have not a bad thing to say about this beach motel. The rooms were clean, location great, wonderful view. I do not like to go to the beach in summer months and have not been to Ocean City in many years but this motel makes me want to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, location & budget”
Reviews.Author: MeadowsValleyForge
Reviews.Content: Place is at the end of the boardwalk, accessible to the tram towards the other end of the boardwalk. We got the room next to the pool, but the ocean is just a few feet away anway..not unless you want a ocean front view in the morning. We got an online deal which adds a free breakfast ($11 per person) at the Dunes HOTEL's Victorian Room restaurant. This is a great bargain considering you take $33 off the daily rate! Rooms are tidy and smells clean. However, the bathroom sink drains slow (Rm 216), otherwise it is fine. I would recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “So very good....I will return as often as I can.”
Reviews.Author: MAGII
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor Hotel was recommended but by mistake I booked reservations at The Dunes Motel.....there was no disappointment. The room provided two double beds, a convertible sofa that opened to a double bed, a table and chairs, a stove, refrigerator and dishes/tableware. The accomodations are very clean (this is my first concern). The bedding was crisp and attractive. A balcony overlooking the ocean provided sounds of the waves and a beautiful ocean view. The restaurant, pool and other amenities in the Hotel are available for the Motel guests. In the evening we enjoyed the piano player (Shirley) and joined in singing to her tunes; a song book was distributed to those setting in the guest area. Food and service was good. I really cannot express what a pleasant trip we had. Our stay was for two days. Plans for future and longer visits are in progress. This is without a doubt the place to stay in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Not great... but not bad by any stretch”
Reviews.Author: jengd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the "suites" which had a bedroom you walked into from the front door, and a murphy bed in a room which had the 1. sofa, 2. kitchenette, 3. table w/ 4 chairs, 4. door to the bathroom and 5. door to the patio which looked out on a sand dune and the beach. We used the first bedroom for our 2yr old son and the larger room for ourselves. It worked well- we could close the door while he slept/napped and we had a tv and kitchenette to ourselves and wouldn't bother him. Additionally, the patio was great for him to play on and we could come and go if he was asleep. The only real negatives were that we had some problems with the key cards and the room was about as far from the office as you can get, the toilet paper roll holder was missing, and the toilet liked to run every 10min or so and no one fixed it while we were there. It's not a glamorous place but it's not expensive and being at the end of the boardwalk makes for good access to the beach and tram.

Reviews.Title: “Dunes Motel”
Reviews.Author: katididit
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I just got back from a week stay at the Dunes. Our room was great with a little kitchen that had everything we needed so we didn't have to eat out all the time. Our room was clean, the service was wonderful and the Oceanfront view from our 4th floor balcony was breathtaking. THANK YOU ....O.C

Reviews.Title: “A Clean Freak's Dream Come True...ahhh”
Reviews.Author: Slickswifey
Reviews.Content: We were so glad we stayed here!!! I read all kinds of reviews on here and I org wanted to stay at the "Castle in the Sand". But I didn't want to pay some ridiculous price, I think staying in a hotel/motel for anything over $200/night is a waste-period. How much time are you really in your room? When you can be spending your $ on other things =) We had an Ocean front efficiency on the 5th floor-We didn't go wrong!!! Big enough for a Lg sized family(5-6) or 2 couples. Two Queen sized beds, fold out leather couch, with a sturdy room divider, Lg bathroom...Oh and we didn't hear a peep out of the neighbors(thick insulated walls) It definitely surpassed our expectations!!! =) Sooo very happy! After I read a previous review of "BUGS" that scared the Heebe Gee-bees out of me, I did not see a ONE!!! Our room was a smoking room on the 5th floor. I was thinking it was going to smell very dingy or like that stale bar room smell....not at all!!! It smelled very fresh and clean! Didn't notice any smoke smell at all. The whole room was newly remodeled and everything was well stocked. Pots & pans,cooking utensils, knives, plates, coffee pot, dish rag & towel, silverware, toaster, ice cubes made in freezer,lg frig, large wall sized mirror across from frig to check yourself out before going out the door...they thought of everything!!! It was like home to us, with all the good things you miss being away from and without all the stuff you went away from!!! And the LOCATION!!! OMG!!! The location couldn't be better!!! Away from the boardwalk masses. Tram station right beside the motel was very convenient. I like the fact that in the morning when you step out onto your balcony and look out you don't have drooves of people staring up at you. All you see is dunes and the sand with the Ocean as the backdrop! Absolutely amazing! My husband kept saying, "I can't imagine staying anywhere else". Also I like the fact that the airconditioner was new and we could control the temperature. If you like it ice cold...ice cold is what you get. Linens on the bed seemed like new as well as the towels. House keeping always did a great job! I owned my own cleaning business and I'm a "clean freak" and with that said, it was a clean freak's dream come true!!! LOL We would not hestitate to stay here again. Do not walk to the Dunes...Run!!! P.S. The only thing that we didn't care for was the parking situation. I think they should have # parking stalls for the rooms. We had to park wherever we could in their lot. Not next to our building not far...but coulda been closer.

Reviews.Title: “We plan to be repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: Daniel21384
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Ocean City since I was in diapers and have stayed in many places, some nice and some not so nice. I've stayed in a lot of hotels up and down the boardwalk as well as some of the higher end hotels like the Princess Royale and the Holiday Inn on the Boardwalk but our family's budget in recent years has put us in a position where we have felt the need to choose smaller and more budget priced hotels and motels. This has often compromised amenities, service, and yes even cleanliness and we have never found a place to return to year after year. Well, our mission was accomplished during our recent stay at the Dunes Motel! I just recently got married and this was my first trip to Ocean City with my wife. My parents also joined us on this trip for a few days and we were able to find two rooms at the Dunes Motel for a week last minute within our price range. We stayed in the West/Poolside building where the rooms have been recently renovated and they did an excellent job. The rooms are tastefully decorated and have all the basics that you'll need for a week at the beach including a microwave and refrigerator, plenty of storage space, and a small but clean bathroom with plenty of fresh towels. The staff at the Dunes is extremely friendly and polite from the desk staff to the maids. The location of the Dunes Motel is great as well because it's at the end of the boardwalk where you can catch the trolly and be to where all the action is in minutes, but you're still far enough away that it's in a more quiet neighborhood. I think that one of the main reasons that the Dunes Motel has a top-notch staff and is so well cared for is that it is basically an extension of the Dunes Manor Hotel which is one of the top hotels in town. We went over to the Victorian Room in the Dunes Manor two mornings for breakfast and were well impressed by the service and the value. We also spent a few evenings in the Zippy Lewis Lounge having drinks and listening to Shirley Toms play the piano. It was a nice touch that we were able to use the Restaurant and Lounge at the Dunes Manor and charge it to our room at the Dunes Motel. All in all we were extremely impressed with the Dunes Motel and this was one of the first times that we've stayed in a small budget priced motel in Ocean City and not had to clean our room before we use it. When plan to only stay at the Dunes Motel or the Dunes Manor from now on when we visit Ocean City and I strongly recommend the Dunes Motel to other as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: slburton3
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion/ vacation in Ocean City this past June. Because our family had stayed at The Dunes years ago, and we knew they had some efficiencies/ larger rooms, this is where we decided to stay again. It was a great decision! I hadn't been to OC since I was a kid, but I was really impressed with the location- right at the end of the Boardwalk. Close enough to the action, but far enough from the party crowd. There was a place to rent bikes right there at the end of the boardwalk, too- always a fun activity, but get there early! My husband and I had a regular hotel room in the "poolside" building, and while it was nothing fancy, it certainly was clean and had that vintage beachy vibe. The cleaning staff were there promptly each morning. My parents had secured one of the 2-bedroom apartments (oceanside), which was on the first floor. It even had a small "lawn" and patio, fenced in, which was perfect for the kiddos, giving everyone space to gather and spread out. My parents and grandparents shared that place. The rest of the family had reserved efficiencies or hotel rooms. There were about 20 of us total, including 6 kids, and I think it all worked out great. With the apartment and efficiency kitchens, we could prepare meals and not have to eat out all the time (though we did enjoy that as well). I feel the prices (we were just coming into high season) were reasonable. We have even been eyeing their off-season prices and wondering if we could make a quick escape this fall! We would definitely stay here again, and hope to make OC an annual destination.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl1407
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews on this Motel and decided to book a room here. I'm glad that we did. We just got back from our summer vacation at Ocean City and had a great time! The Dunes Motel is in a GREAT LOCATION! I wanted to be on the boarwalk and on the beach and this was exactly that. The motel was at the end of the boarwalk which was perfect as this was the quieter end of the boardwalk. The motel is right on the beach, just steps to the ocean and sand. We had a room with a pool view (which was cheaper in price as we went at peak summer time rates). This was fine for us as we did not plan to spend a lot of time in the room. The Motel is older, but the rooms were clean! The only negative thing that I would have to say about the motel is the bathroom in our room was very small. We only used the pool once because we spent most of our time on the beach. But the pool was clean. The boardwalk tram stops right at the hotel. We only rode it once as could get quite expensive if you rode it to the other end of boardwalk all the time. It was $3 per person each way. Overall, if you are looking for a clean place to lay your head at night with no frill and a great location this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Close to the Ocean!!!”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Motel over the July 4 holiday weekend. We booked into a "2-room patio apartment" in the oceanside building (not the poolside buildings). We loved it! The room: We had a 2-room patio apartment. I Enter into a bedroom with 2 beds, a dresser and 2 nightstands and an open-closet area/corner easily big enough to store a cooler and suitcases after you've unpacked. Bathroom was roomy, much larger than the baths in the poolside buildings and more updated with larger cabinetry/sinktop area. Living/kitchen area had a pull-out sofa, side table and a table for 4 with a small full-size fridge/freezer and mini range with small sink area. Too small to spend more than 3-4 days and not big enough to actually cook meals and eat - we always eat out. Patio area: we were first floor so had a nice patio area with overlooked the dunes. If you are not ground level, you had a balcony and a view of the ocean. The patio area is great if you have small kids because they have an outdoor area to play and each unit is INDIVIDUALLY fenced in and gated. We had 2 lounge chairs and 2 chairs with blooming day lillies. Just a short walk over the dune area and there was the beach. An easy walk if you want to return to make lunch or use the restroom. If you need extra room, The Dunes has many different-type rooms, including some 2-bedroom 1st floor units. Housekeeping: always wonderful. I've stayed here many times and staff is very nice and does a fine job. Location, location, location: At the end of the boardwalk at 27th Street. Don't underestimate this location as being at the end of all the action. At the end of a long day, it's nice to be away from the action. Just beside The Dunes you can rent your bikes for the boardwalk each morning. The beach isn't as crowded as farther down the boardwalk either. I highly recommend you DON'T stay at this hotel during the month of June. Or any hotel in Ocean City for that matter. That entire month is considered "senior week" for students graduating from high school. Ocean City itself is completely taken over by high school grads who can't handle their booze or act appropriately. It's not a month to take your kids and your time WILL be ruined. In OC, there's a law that says hotels can not discriminate against renters based on their age and so they must rent to them, however, it's hard to control their behavior. If you're looking for good mexican food, try Tequila Mockingbird at 130th street in the Montego Bay shopping center. Looks like a dive, but food is great. Also, for crabs I recommend PGN crabhouse on 29th Street and Higgins Crab House on 30th Street. Call ahead though to make sure they actually DO have all-you-can-eat crabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for young people, especially those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: cking2007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Dunes Motel (poolside) from June 1-5. This motel is great. There were no problems checking in/out, and no problems with any of the staff. The rooms were recently remodeled, and very clean as well. It's so close to the boardwalk, and just steps away from the ocean, which we loved. We were also given a voucher, which we could use at the sister hotel-- we only went there for breakfast, but it was very good! The best thing of all is that it was very affordable! By the end of the trip we were seriously considering staying a few extra days, but the main thing that kept us from that was rainy weather. We really hope to visit again next year! Don't hesitate to stay at this motel!

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Dunes Motel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburgh-Pa-Mom
Reviews.Content: My children and I had a great time at this Motel. I stayed on the 5th floor ocean front. I loved waking early every morning to the sound of that ocean. The dolphins pasted by every morning. The seagulls flew at eye level to our deck. We could hear other wild birds roaming the dunes. The tram in very near by- The room is just fine and includes dishes and such for your cooking needs. I would LOVE to go back and just NEVER EVER leave!! I love the sister Hotel !! It was GREAT to be invited to use all they have to offer like the indoor heated pool with a hot tub--The Gym,Dinningroom,lounge and bike rack!! I would only suggest that they add video cams to the elevator and at every level of the elevator exits at the motel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Dunes”
Reviews.Author: nanaof3
Reviews.Content: We found the Dunes Motel to be a nice place to stay for the price. It's location is ideal directly at the end of the boardwalk. Tram stops right aside of the hotel which is great. We stayed for 3 nights in May for Cruisin Weekend. We watched the car parade from our balcony It was one of the nicest accomodations we have found at a reasonable rate. It is not a four star hotel but I don't feel it necessary to stay in one and I didn't expecct it to be at the rate we paid. The room was clean upon arrival and well kept. The room looked like it was somewhat remodeled recently. We had a efficiency. Small kitchen was nice to use. The staff as a whole was pleasant and the room was cleaned in a timely fashion each day. The only downside to our stay there was the one elevator they have was not working one evening when we returned. Walking up five flights of stairs ( of course we were lucky to be on the 5th floor! ) did not thrill me in the least! The older woman at the front desk that night was not very pleasant about it either. Elevator was not fixed until the next morning. A discount coupon for a restaurant or a voucher for a free or disounted stay the next time we booked there would have been nice to compensate us for the inconvenience. Nothing was offered! It seems good customer service is a thing of the past unless you pay $400.00 a night. I would still recommend this motel and will probably stay there again in May of 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Found it quite pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Father-of-6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanfront effiecientcy on the third floor on a Sunday and Monday night. Sept 28 and 29. Beth at the front desk was very pleasant. We got our room about 1pm. All the staff were very friendly. The room was clean. I would only suggest one change. They could put one dresser or desk in the room. Theres a big space where they only have one of those little folding stands for a suitcase. There are no dressers or desks, so there was no place to sit suitcases and the like. There were five of us and we kept having to move our things around depending on whether it was dinner time, bedtime, etc. We used some of the facilities at the newer Dunes Manor next door. My wife especially enjoyed the afternoon tea over there. We had a wonderful view of the ocean. It was warm enough to keep the windows and door open to the balcony and sleep soundly listening to the ocean. I would go back to the Dunes any time we want to go to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hey_Vanity
Reviews.Content: Myself,husband and daughter stayed at the Dunes Motel the last week of Labor Day of 2008 and after reading some of these reviews I as well kinda became worried if we made the right choice when we made our reservations and paid for our oceanfront efficiency . But we figured we give it a shot and walk away with our own opinion afterwards. Check in was a breeze,the front desk lady was polite and accommodating,since our room wasn't ready.,she still gave us a parking pass so that we could keep our vehicle in the motel lot and offered that we were welcome over at their sister Hotel next door and use their pool/dressing facilities and restaurant. When our room was ready I was really quite pleased when we walked into our room despite the older look of the building. The room was clean,no bugs as one of the reviewers commented,no mold/mildew that I saw. I was expecting a shoe box sized room from another review but it seemed very spacious for our crew,the beds seemed big enough for me even supplied extra pillows and linens for the pull out couch that I will say had seen its better days but personally I don't let a small matter like that ruin my whole stay. There was a bright wide window with a gorgeous view of the ocean and beach right infront of us,with a door with a lock that could open out towards an enclosed balcony. The kitchen and sink area seemed efficient enough for our stay. We brought our own food from home to cook in the room during our stay and there was enough cabinet space and refrigerator space. Bathroom was small but again,there was enough room to hold our toiletries in a cabinet under the sink and well equipped with lots of towels. The floor was clean but my only complaint was that the water pressure was alittle strong,but we theorized that was to spray the sand off your body from the beach in the shower. In front of the motel is a large fenced in sand dune that are considered few and a protected resource down at any beach due to the fact local birds and wildlife reside in them and I did not see a piece of garbage,anywhere,anyplace to tell you the truth. Outdoor pool was alittle small,but I don't go to the beach to swim in Olympic sized swimming pools at motels. The indoor outdoor pool was warmed like bathwater,clean,kept my daughter happy when the weather was kinda cloudy out that day. I didn't try the jacuzzi since I am currently pregnant but dipped my toes in the water, husband liked it and btw,jacuzzis are supposed to be hot and you're not supposed to stay in one all day. The motel is situated right at the beginning of the Boardwalk right on 27th street,you can catch a Boardwalk Tram car right there,in the morning you can watch people rent out bicycles and bicycle carts,while watching Ocean Citys trademark sunrises drinking a hot cup of coffee from the coffee maker already supplied in our room. We were just shaking our heads wondering if the people whom really put this place down stayed in some either really fancy hotels or are really picky about things to come to some of the conclusions they did. I was really happy with our pick,if we weren't going to be renting something bigger next year I would be more then happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: pafamilydogs
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was a little scared on what to expect. My only complaint is that we did not get the floor we requested. There is a LARGE dune in front of the Motel so if you don't want an ocean view the first floor is where you want to be. We were still able to see the ocean from the 2nd floor. Room was very clean. A little on the small side. We arrived early, which doesn't happen very often, and we were not allowed in our room. So when we came back later we had to wait because a man was trying to get an OF room at a poolside rate. UGH! I think if you arrive there around 12:30 you should have no problem with parking. I did notice it was VERY crowded later. But we park our car and don't move it until we leave so this was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick!”
Reviews.Author: hipsthathop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Motel from 8/11/08-8/15/08. A friend of mine recommended this motel to me. I've had some bad experiences with other motels so I was a little frantic. However, there was no need to worry this time. One of the most important things to me is the cleanliness of the facility. The room was very clean, (and believe me I checked everything 2x), the overall facility was clean. The ocean view was amazing & the room was the perfect size for me, my husband & my 4 year old son ( I wouldn’t recommend more than 4 people per room, as the rooms aren’t large enough to fit more than that).. A few things could have been better to make our stay more convenient/comfortable; the beds were very uncomfortable (the cheapest mattress set on the planet must have been on what we were sleeping on), there is no iron/ironing board in the room (you have to call down to the front desk to ask for it), there were only 3 drawers (so we had to leave all of our stuff in the suit case), and last but not least, parking was terrible. But these minor things didn't amount enough to ruin our stay. We had a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Was Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ZorraPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 children stayed at the Dunes Motel from July 27, 2008. Our first impression of the motel was a smelly wet elevator. When we opened the door to our room... our smiles left our faces. The room was ALOT smaller than we expected. For a room that "sleeps 6 " they only had 3 small drawers to put your clothes in. We had to leave our clothes in our suitcases and...not much room for your suitcases!The very small kitchen had only 1 sink, making it very difficult to wash dishes. The bathroom floor was a mess! it was all stained up and in need of replacement. I had to leave my shoes on! Very excited to have an oceanfront balcony a place where we like to relax was even disappointing. They have a fenced in dune as long as the building that is loaded with GARBAGE!!! If you can over look the garbage, the view of course is great! The beds are small, my husband and I had to sleep in separate beds, and the children had to sleep on the SPRINGY sofa bed, not fit for a dog!!!The air conditioner was very noisy, rattling on and off during the night, waking us up several times. The pool...a must for us, was FREEZING COLD, making it very difficult to enjoy the pool. We are allowed to go over to the Dunes HOTEL , so we ventured over to their "pools." The HOTEL states they have an indoor and an outdoor pool, what they don't tell you is that it is (half indoor and half outdoor) only 1 pool. That explains why they don't show it on-line. The HOTEL pool temp. is in the 80 s and mostly shaded. The jacuzzi temp. was 110 degrees!!! very uncomfortable, not able to stay in more than 4 minutes. I realize you get what you pay for. What it cost to stay at the Dunes Motel, is not worth the money you spend. My family and I do not get away much, did not feel like a vacation. We felt robbed and will never stay at the Dunes Motel again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: schatzebabie
Reviews.Content: Our stay was booked for Friday through Sunday and we had a 2 night free stay because of the problems we had last year at this motel. VICKY MORRIS, the hotel/motel manager/owner should not be in this position. Never in my life have I EVER been treated the way I was treat.ed My friend and I were degraded and harrased by the Dunes motel/hotel staff and managers and owner, VICKY MORRIS. After driving 7 hours, we were unable to check in because there computers were down. Then they give us the key to a tupperwear box room pool side, when we booked an OCEANFRONT ROOM!!! Then, manager Armando gets involved by phone. Finally, hours later after screaming over the phone, he leaves a message on our room phone that an oceanfront room will be ready in the morning and his manager, Vicky Morris, will be contacting us at 9AM. That is when Vicky Morris calls and shows how ignorant she really is. This woman needs to be fired or her license should be taken away. With an attitude, she started out saying that we were refusing to pay for our second night, and she treatened to keep our belongings because we would not have access to our room, even though all of our paper work stated we were booked until Sunday!!!! Even our parking permit said Sundays date!!!!!!! After we were threatened, we met her in the lobby, called the police and filed a report, then called the better business bureau. The police department stated there has been 5 reports of items stolen from this motel in the past 2 years. Finally, after another wasted hour of our vacation, we finally are told we can move to our ocean front room, but we have to pay the $70 dollar difference. We say fine!! She then says, once she sees the coupon code, she will refund the money...not a problem. It will be faxed later in the day to her. We think all is settled and we move on, pack up our stuff, move to our room, unpack AGAIN, the phone rings....its them again.....the credit card isn't working....come back down.....UNBELIEVABLE!!!! So we go back down!!!!! They are trying to bill us for the entire ocean front room, not the difference of the poolside room of $70!!!!! So we kindly explain to the motel staff, who should know simple math, to transfer the amount that was paid at check in. We just paid the $70 in cash and left. Over and done with..... Back to room we go.....phone rings again.....didn't answer it......phone rings again......didn't answer it.......This time they left a message....At this point, we are so ticked off, we just want to leave. So we go to the beach. When we get back 1/2 hour later, we check the message. It is the hotel staff again wanting us to come down to the lobby again....So we take a shower. But, before we can leave..there is a knock at the door. IT"S VICKY MORRIS, HOTEL MANAGER/OWNER!!!!! WOW.......Now, She is saying that we are going around telling people that we were overcharged!!! Unbelievable!!!!!! Not only that, She is still telling us that we have a balance due of $286.00!!!! UH, NO WE DON'T!!!!! And that our credit card is still declined. So, We call the credit card company. PLEASE PAY ATTENTION TO THIS!!!! We found out that the hotel charged the credit card 7 times for the 2nd night (over $1000.00).
