There were multiple charges all within 5 minutes of each other. The credit card company caught it as fraudulent charges and put a hold on it and contacted the home number and alerted us). It was coming up declined by the motel staff because the charged was already put through at check in and signed for. (Duplicate charge) Thank god for fraud alert!!! When we went to Vicky Morris's office at the hotel, she had 4 security guards waiting for us. She still insisted our card was bad...denying it was there mistake. At this point, we just couldn't take it anymore. Our vacation for the 2 days we had been there already had been ruined. We had spend those 2 days arguing and being harrased by the Dunes motel/hotel staff. This behavior is completely wrong and uncalled for and something should be done about it. No customer should be treated like this!!! Every person who we saw that weekend complained about there stay, I am not joking. When we left, we found another hotel and when we explained what happend, the people around even said how bad this place is. Be aware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie8671
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Hampton Inns but the price was outrageous on the beach so we picked the Dunes. We loved our stay here!!! I was kind of nervous because of reading a few of the reviews about bugs and mold/mildew in the bathroom but we couldn't have been happier with this hotel!!! The room was VERY clean and everything was new. I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever. It was definitely better than what I was expecting. The staff (especially the housekeeper) was VERY friendly and helpful. She even helped me find sunglasses that were misplaced in the room! Check-in wasn't until 3:00pm but we arrived at 8:00am. The room was still occupied at that time but ,as soon as they left, the room was cleaned for us and we were in by 11:30am. I saw NO bugs at all... and trust me I looked everywhere. The kitchen was immaculate and spotless. The fridge was totally cleaned out, not a spot anywhere. I walked past a room being cleaned out after the people checked out, they were washing out the refridgerator with bleach water. I could smell it. They even supplied the dishcloth, towel, dish soap, and drainer. The bathroom was spotless as well. No mold, mildew, or anything. I have no idea how they get all the sand out of the bathtub after people checkout but they do! :O) If you plan on eating in the hotel room, I would suggest bringing your own food. We brought most of our dry foods but decided to buy the cold stuff in OC instead of trying to fit a cooler in the trunk. Wish now that we'd have brought our own. The prices were high compared to where we're from (WV). The Wal-Mart 4 miles from OC on 50 was not a Super Wal-Mart and had next to nothing in it foodwise... we then went to the Food Lion which is right before the last bridge to OC (about 1/2 a mile from the beach) on 611 and the prices were high. $2.50 for a loaf of food lion bread if you don't have their card. I'm used to 1.00 a loaf at Wal-Mart!! :O) The food at the boardwalk places was very high too. Especially for little things. We ate at Ember's all you can eat seafood buffet and ended up with a $140.00 bill ($30.00 per person). But it was really good. On the boardwalk was an all you can eat buffet called Paul Revere and it was only about $11.00 per person (not $30.00 like Embers). We heard it was good but never got to go there to eat. Wish we would have found it sooner! Other than the price of food... our stay was great and our hotel was even better! :O)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: helton926
Reviews.Content: This stay was very nice. Clean rooms, very comfortable. Beautiful view. I would reccomend this hotel for a weeks stay. prices are reasonable. well worth the money. it's located at the end of the boardwalk. So I suggest paying for the train ride you can pay $20.00 for 10 rides. Or $3.00 a ride.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Bawlmer_Travler
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 11-13, 2008. The Dunes Motel is a seprate building from thier hotel. We found it to be in outstanding condition even though it is an older building. It was impecably clean. Wonderful pool, great locating 1/2 block to beach on the north end of the boardwalk. Staff was friendly and always acknowledged you in passing. Overall a wonderful experience and value. Will certainly stay again when going back to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the beach!”
Reviews.Author: mylittletraveler
Reviews.Content: I went here with my family for many years and we were always happy with the place. Great views, right on the beach, the start of the boardwalk, clean and nice. perfect for a family! a nice pool small for the place though. It can get a little loud at times if you have a room near the tram-car, i had a room there for a week and it got a little loud so if you can try and request another room. out of all the years my family went there i only saw one bug so bugs were not really a problem. The rooms are perfect for a family of 4 (there have a pull-out sofa that sleps 2) so you can have 6 people in a room but it wil get small. The kitchen is small but perfect. i have always had a ocean front view for my family enjoys that and the views are great. it would be me my husband and the 2 kids and there was somthing for everyone. the prices are great and if you have AAA you can get a discount. I dont go there and though for the crowd at OC is a young and is starting to become a party place for collage kids. However the stay was great and you will enjoy it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dunes”
Reviews.Author: Jammie9973
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Dunes back in the late 80's and then again in May of 2007. We stayed for a week each time we went. We had an oceanfront efficiency each time and the rooms were gorgeous. They were very spacious and equipped with kitchen, bath, 2 beds, tv, sofa, table and chairs. There is a door to the balcony as well as a huge sliding window. Having dinner at the table over looking the ocean is quite romantic. The view is breathtaking. The staff was very friendly and our room was cleaned everyday we were there. There was never a complaint. We even recommended the Dunes to friends of ours who stayed in August of 2007 and they were very pleased. We are going back again in May of 2008 to celebrate our 25th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views & right on the beach!! Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: kimmiebrite
Reviews.Content: Delmarva Bikeweek 2007...hard to find a place to stay where everyone's not partying all night long. The Dunes Motel is the BEST!! Got a room at a GR8 rate at the last minute for 2 nights. We had an AWESOME room, oceanfront smoking efficiency. With a full KITCHENETTE!! Check in was soooo easy & pleasant & our room was ready 5 hours early...they let us in! What a wonderful welcome. The room, linens, flatware, etc. were absolutely clean & the room smelled clean. We both opened the door to the hotel room & felt like we were home...and I felt safe the entire time. The bus stop is 2 blocks away to go down to the inlet area & it's right in front of a 7-11 for convenient stuff. The ocean view can't be beat & the staff are super responsive & friendly. This is it from now on...whenever we go to Ocean City we're staying at the Dunes Motel! It was just my husband & myself, but there were plenty of families but no noisy kids :) What a great experience. You will enjoy your stay at this place! For an ocean front room with daily maid service you CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cjohnstonnn
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these most recent reviews I thought to myself did these people stay at the same place I did. The rates are great for what you get. I researched for hours and could not find another place as economical as the Dunes Motel and offered such great things, like closeness to boardwalk, on the ocean , and outdoor pool. We stayed there a couple of weeks ago and the desk staff was nothing short of amazing. At check in the Desk clerk Beth who was slammed in a previous review went out of her way to find a couple local destinations for myself and my husband were looking for. She was also very generous with her time and patience as I had alot of questions about nearby attractions. The Housekeepers were very friendly and greeted us each time they saw us. Our room was extremely clean and no sign of any bugs. I think some people must expect the moon and the stars for the low rates this motel charges. Hon, if you want that stay at the Hilton and recieve those services, than go ahead and pay $500 plus a night. If you want a great little Ocean Motel just steps to boardwalk , at a price that your family can afford stay here. We had a great time and thanks in part to the amazing staff including the girl in the daytime Aretha who was always very professional and accomodating, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES !!!!!!! not just 1 but hundreds....swarmed the floor”
Reviews.Author: crisco250
Reviews.Content: ROACHES is all I have to say..... Hundreds of ROACHES in the kitchenette part when we came in at night to rest we packed up and left.......

Reviews.Title: “Run The Other Way”
Reviews.Author: theeverharts
Reviews.Content: The management at the Dunes was terrible. The day after we checked in we discovered they had made a mistake with our check-out date (a day before it was supposed to be). We followed their instructions and pointed it out as soon as possble but were told it was our problem. Their only recourse was to attempt to have us violate regulations and put us in a room rated for fewer people in our party and put a cot in for the 2 extra. Oh, and they were going to charge us extra for the move as well. We spent the last day at the Dunes searching for another room instead of relaxing with our kids on their first trip to the ocean. I would never stay at the Dunes and will tell everyone to stay away. Aside from that problem, the room was dirty and not worth the money. Go elsewhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: tjenik
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend , and I and as well as his family stayed at the Dunes Motel (which is next door to the manor) this past summer. We had great room service. We were the last room to get cleaned, and the housekeepers still cleaned our room by 1 pm everyday. Our efficency was big and comfortable for 5 of us. It was an afforadble vacation, and was still half the price of the manor hotel. I loved it so much that Im going back in August.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TwoBkLabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Motel and it was wonderful. Very clean. We had an oceanfront room on the third floor. It was equipped with a coffeemaker, stove, refrigerator, microwave, pots and pans, dishes, silverwear, dish cloths and drying towels, and even dish detergent. The room has two double beds, a table with four chairs, TV, and a couch that pulls out to accommodate two more people. There was also a bacony with two chairs. The ocean is right outside the motel. The room was very clean with maid service every day. I would recommend this motel to everyone. We had friends who stayed at the Dunes Hotel the same time we did and their room was smaller, had no balcony and a microwave, but the price for the Hotel is much more than the Motel. Beause we stayed at the Motel we were able to use the facilities at the hotel - indoor pool, restaurant and bar, and the gym. We will be going back for the Sunfest in September.

HotelInfo.Name: Dunes Motel
HotelInfo.Address: On the Beach at 27th Street, 2700 Baltimore Ave, Ocean City, MD 21842
